trans-unit.source: Configuring Application Insights SDK with ApplicationInsights.config or .xml
trans-unit.target: Configuring Application Insights SDK with ApplicationInsights.config or .xml

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable data collection modules, and add performance counters and other parameters
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable data collection modules, and add performance counters and other parameters

trans-unit.source: Configuring the Application Insights SDK with ApplicationInsights.config or .xml
trans-unit.target: Configuring the Application Insights SDK with ApplicationInsights.config or .xml

trans-unit.source: The Application Insights .NET SDK consists of a number of NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: The Application Insights .NET SDK consists of a number of NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>core package</linkText><title></title></link> provides the API for sending telemetry to
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>core package</linkText><title></title></link> provides the API for sending telemetry to

trans-unit.source: the Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: the Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Additional packages</linkText><title></title></link> provide
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Additional packages</linkText><title></title></link> provide

trans-unit.source: telemetry modules and initializers for automatically tracking telemetry from your application and its context.
trans-unit.target: telemetry modules and initializers for automatically tracking telemetry from your application and its context.

trans-unit.source: By
trans-unit.target: By

trans-unit.source: adjusting the configuration file, you can enable or disable telemetry modules and initializers, and set parameters for
trans-unit.target: adjusting the configuration file, you can enable or disable telemetry modules and initializers, and set parameters for

trans-unit.source: some of them.
trans-unit.target: some of them.

trans-unit.source: The configuration file is named ApplicationInsights.config or ApplicationInsights.xml, depending on the type of your
trans-unit.target: The configuration file is named ApplicationInsights.config or ApplicationInsights.xml, depending on the type of your

trans-unit.source: application.
trans-unit.target: application.

trans-unit.source: It is automatically added to your project when you <link><linkText>install some versions of the SDK[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: It is automatically added to your project when you <link><linkText>install some versions of the SDK[start]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It is also added to a web app
trans-unit.target: It is also added to a web app

trans-unit.source: by <link><linkText>Status Monitor on an IIS server[redfield]</linkText><title></title></link>, or when you select the Appplication Insights
trans-unit.target: by <link><linkText>Status Monitor on an IIS server[redfield]</linkText><title></title></link>, or when you select the Appplication Insights

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>extension for an Azure website or VM[azure]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>extension for an Azure website or VM[azure]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: There isn't an equivalent file to control the <link><linkText>SDK in a web page[client]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: There isn't an equivalent file to control the <link><linkText>SDK in a web page[client]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: There's a node in the configuration file for each module.
trans-unit.target: There's a node in the configuration file for each module.

trans-unit.source: To disable a module, delete the node or comment it out.
trans-unit.target: To disable a module, delete the node or comment it out.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in the
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in the

trans-unit.source: ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: The DiagnosticsTelemetryModule reports errors in the Application Insights instrumenation code itself.
trans-unit.target: The DiagnosticsTelemetryModule reports errors in the Application Insights instrumenation code itself.

trans-unit.source: For example,
trans-unit.target: For example,

trans-unit.source: if the code cannot access performance counters or if an ITelemetryInitializer throws an exception.
trans-unit.target: if the code cannot access performance counters or if an ITelemetryInitializer throws an exception.

trans-unit.source: Trace telemetry
trans-unit.target: Trace telemetry

trans-unit.source: tracked by this module appears in the <link><linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: tracked by this module appears in the <link><linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DependencyCollector</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DependencyCollector</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DependencyCollector NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DependencyCollector NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in

trans-unit.source: ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: The DependencyTrackingTelemetryModule tracks telemetry about calls to external dependencies made by your application,
trans-unit.target: The DependencyTrackingTelemetryModule tracks telemetry about calls to external dependencies made by your application,

trans-unit.source: such as HTTP requests and SQL queries.
trans-unit.target: such as HTTP requests and SQL queries.

trans-unit.source: To allow this module to work in an IIS server, you need to <link><linkText>install Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To allow this module to work in an IIS server, you need to <link><linkText>install Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To use it in Azure web apps or VMs, <link><linkText>select the Application Insights extension[azure]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To use it in Azure web apps or VMs, <link><linkText>select the Application Insights extension[azure]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also write your own dependency tracking code using the <link><linkText>TrackDependency API</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can also write your own dependency tracking code using the <link><linkText>TrackDependency API</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web NuGet package provides the following telemetry initializers and modules in the
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web NuGet package provides the following telemetry initializers and modules in the

trans-unit.source: ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: Initializers
trans-unit.target: Initializers

trans-unit.source: SyntheticTelemetryInitializer updates the User, Session and Operation contexts properties of all telemetry
trans-unit.target: SyntheticTelemetryInitializer updates the User, Session and Operation contexts properties of all telemetry

trans-unit.source: items tracked when handling a request from a synthetic source, such as an availability test.
trans-unit.target: items tracked when handling a request from a synthetic source, such as an availability test.

trans-unit.source: The Application Insights
trans-unit.target: The Application Insights

trans-unit.source: portal does not display synthetic telemetry by default.
trans-unit.target: portal does not display synthetic telemetry by default.

trans-unit.source: ClientIpHeaderTelemetryInitializer updates Ip property of the Location context of all telemetry items based on the
trans-unit.target: ClientIpHeaderTelemetryInitializer updates Ip property of the Location context of all telemetry items based on the

trans-unit.source: X-Forwarded-For HTTP header of the request.
trans-unit.target: X-Forwarded-For HTTP header of the request.

trans-unit.source: UserAgentTelemetryInitializer updates the UserAgent property of the User context of all telemetry items based
trans-unit.target: UserAgentTelemetryInitializer updates the UserAgent property of the User context of all telemetry items based

trans-unit.source: on the User-Agent HTTP header of the request.
trans-unit.target: on the User-Agent HTTP header of the request.

trans-unit.source: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the Name property of the RequestTelemetry and the Name property of
trans-unit.target: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the Name property of the RequestTelemetry and the Name property of

trans-unit.source: the Operation context of all telemetry items based on the HTTP method, as well as names of ASP.NET MVC controller and
trans-unit.target: the Operation context of all telemetry items based on the HTTP method, as well as names of ASP.NET MVC controller and

trans-unit.source: action invoked to process the request.
trans-unit.target: action invoked to process the request.

trans-unit.source: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the 'Operation.Id` context property of all telemetry items tracked while
trans-unit.target: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the 'Operation.Id` context property of all telemetry items tracked while

trans-unit.source: handling a request with the automatically generated RequestTelemetry.Id.
trans-unit.target: handling a request with the automatically generated RequestTelemetry.Id.

trans-unit.source: UserTelemetryInitializer updates the Id and AcquisitionDate properties of User context for all telemetry items
trans-unit.target: UserTelemetryInitializer updates the Id and AcquisitionDate properties of User context for all telemetry items

trans-unit.source: with values extracted from the ai_user cookie generated by the Application Insights JavaScript instrumentation code
trans-unit.target: with values extracted from the ai_user cookie generated by the Application Insights JavaScript instrumentation code

trans-unit.source: running in the user's browser.
trans-unit.target: running in the user's browser.

trans-unit.source: SessionTelemetryInitializer updates the Id property of the Session context for all telemetry items with value
trans-unit.target: SessionTelemetryInitializer updates the Id property of the Session context for all telemetry items with value

trans-unit.source: extracted from the ai_session cookie generated by the ApplicationInsights JavaScript instrumentation code running in the
trans-unit.target: extracted from the ai_session cookie generated by the ApplicationInsights JavaScript instrumentation code running in the

trans-unit.source: user's browser.
trans-unit.target: user's browser.

trans-unit.source: AzureRoleEnvironmentTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleName and RoleInstance properties of the Device context
trans-unit.target: AzureRoleEnvironmentTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleName and RoleInstance properties of the Device context

trans-unit.source: for all telemetry items with information extracted from the Azure runtime environment.
trans-unit.target: for all telemetry items with information extracted from the Azure runtime environment.

trans-unit.source: DomainNameRoleInstanceTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleInstance property of the Device context for all
trans-unit.target: DomainNameRoleInstanceTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleInstance property of the Device context for all

trans-unit.source: telemetry items with the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.
trans-unit.target: telemetry items with the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.

trans-unit.source: BuildInfoConfigComponentVersionTelemetryInitializer updates the Version property of the Component context for
trans-unit.target: BuildInfoConfigComponentVersionTelemetryInitializer updates the Version property of the Component context for

trans-unit.source: all telemetry items with the value extracted from the BuildInfo.config file produced by TFS build.
trans-unit.target: all telemetry items with the value extracted from the BuildInfo.config file produced by TFS build.

trans-unit.source: DeviceTelemetryInitializer updates the following properties of the Device context for all telemetry items.
trans-unit.target: DeviceTelemetryInitializer updates the following properties of the Device context for all telemetry items.

trans-unit.source: Type is set to "PC"
trans-unit.target: Type is set to "PC"

trans-unit.source: Id is set to the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.
trans-unit.target: Id is set to the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.

trans-unit.source: OemName is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Manufacturer field using WMI.
trans-unit.target: OemName is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Manufacturer field using WMI.

trans-unit.source: Model is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Model field using WMI.
trans-unit.target: Model is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Model field using WMI.

trans-unit.source: NetworkType is set to the value extracted from the NetworkInterface.
trans-unit.target: NetworkType is set to the value extracted from the NetworkInterface.

trans-unit.source: Language is set to the name of the CurrentCulture.
trans-unit.target: Language is set to the name of the CurrentCulture.

trans-unit.source: Modules
trans-unit.target: Modules

trans-unit.source: RequestTrackingTelemetryModule tracks requests received by your web app and measures the response times.
trans-unit.target: RequestTrackingTelemetryModule tracks requests received by your web app and measures the response times.

trans-unit.source: ExceptionTrackingTelemetryModule tracks unhandled exceptions in your web app.
trans-unit.target: ExceptionTrackingTelemetryModule tracks unhandled exceptions in your web app.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Failures and exceptions[exceptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Failures and exceptions[exceptions]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: DeveloperModeWithDebuggerAttachedTelemetryModule forces the Application Insights TelemetryChannel to send data
trans-unit.target: DeveloperModeWithDebuggerAttachedTelemetryModule forces the Application Insights TelemetryChannel to send data

trans-unit.source: immediately, one telemetry item at a time, when a debugger is attached to the application process.
trans-unit.target: immediately, one telemetry item at a time, when a debugger is attached to the application process.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the
trans-unit.target: This reduces the

trans-unit.source: amount of time between the moment when your application tracks telemetry and when it appears on the Application Insights
trans-unit.target: amount of time between the moment when your application tracks telemetry and when it appears on the Application Insights

trans-unit.source: portal at the cost of significant CPU and network bandwidth overhead.
trans-unit.target: portal at the cost of significant CPU and network bandwidth overhead.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.PerfCounterCollector</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.PerfCounterCollector</linkText><title></title></link> NuGet package

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.PerfCounterCollector NuGet package adds the following telemetry modules to the ApplicationInsights.config by default.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.PerfCounterCollector NuGet package adds the following telemetry modules to the ApplicationInsights.config by default.

trans-unit.source: PerformanceCollectorModule
trans-unit.target: PerformanceCollectorModule

trans-unit.source: PerformanceCollectorModule tracks a number of Windows performance counters.
trans-unit.target: PerformanceCollectorModule tracks a number of Windows performance counters.

trans-unit.source: You can see these
trans-unit.target: You can see these

trans-unit.source: counters when you click a chart in Metric Explorer to open its details blade.
trans-unit.target: counters when you click a chart in Metric Explorer to open its details blade.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor additional performance counters - both standard Windows counters and any others that you have added.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor additional performance counters - both standard Windows counters and any others that you have added.

trans-unit.source: Use the following syntax to collect additional performance counters:
trans-unit.target: Use the following syntax to collect additional performance counters:

trans-unit.source: PerformanceCounter must be either \CategoryName(InstanceName)\CounterName or \CategoryName\CounterName
trans-unit.target: PerformanceCounter must be either \CategoryName(InstanceName)\CounterName or \CategoryName\CounterName

trans-unit.source: If you provide a ReportAs attribute, this will be used as the name displayed in Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: If you provide a ReportAs attribute, this will be used as the name displayed in Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: For reporting to Application Insights, counter names must include only: letters, round brackets, forward slashes, hyphens, underscores, spaces and dots.
trans-unit.target: For reporting to Application Insights, counter names must include only: letters, round brackets, forward slashes, hyphens, underscores, spaces and dots.

trans-unit.source: You must use ReportAs if the counter you want to monitor contains any invalid characters such as '#' or digits.
trans-unit.target: You must use ReportAs if the counter you want to monitor contains any invalid characters such as '#' or digits.

trans-unit.source: The following placeholders are supported as InstanceName:
trans-unit.target: The following placeholders are supported as InstanceName:

trans-unit.source: Channel parameters (Java)
trans-unit.target: Channel parameters (Java)

trans-unit.source: These parameters affect how the Java SDK should store and flush the telemetry data that it collects.
trans-unit.target: These parameters affect how the Java SDK should store and flush the telemetry data that it collects.

trans-unit.source: MaxTelemetryBufferCapacity
trans-unit.target: MaxTelemetryBufferCapacity

trans-unit.source: The number of telemetry items that can be stored in the SDK's in-memory storage.
trans-unit.target: The number of telemetry items that can be stored in the SDK's in-memory storage.

trans-unit.source: When this number is reached, the telemetry buffer is flushed - that is, the telemetry items are sent to the Application Insights server.
trans-unit.target: When this number is reached, the telemetry buffer is flushed - that is, the telemetry items are sent to the Application Insights server.

trans-unit.source: Min: 1
trans-unit.target: Min: 1

trans-unit.source: Default: 500
trans-unit.target: Default: 500

trans-unit.source: FlushIntervalInSeconds
trans-unit.target: FlushIntervalInSeconds

trans-unit.source: Determines how often the data that is stored in the in-memory storage should be flushed (sent to Application Insights).
trans-unit.target: Determines how often the data that is stored in the in-memory storage should be flushed (sent to Application Insights).

trans-unit.source: Min: 1
trans-unit.target: Min: 1

trans-unit.source: Max: 300
trans-unit.target: Max: 300

trans-unit.source: Default: 5
trans-unit.target: Default: 5

trans-unit.source: MaxTransmissionStorageCapacityInMB
trans-unit.target: MaxTransmissionStorageCapacityInMB

trans-unit.source: Determines the maximum size in MB that is allotted to the persistent storage on the local disk.
trans-unit.target: Determines the maximum size in MB that is allotted to the persistent storage on the local disk.

trans-unit.source: This storage is used for persisting telemetry items that failed to be transmitted to the Application Insights endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This storage is used for persisting telemetry items that failed to be transmitted to the Application Insights endpoint.

trans-unit.source: When the storage size has been met, new telemetry items will be discarded.
trans-unit.target: When the storage size has been met, new telemetry items will be discarded.

trans-unit.source: Min: 1
trans-unit.target: Min: 1

trans-unit.source: Max: 100
trans-unit.target: Max: 100

trans-unit.source: Default: 10
trans-unit.target: Default: 10

trans-unit.source: Custom Initializers
trans-unit.target: Custom Initializers

trans-unit.source: If the standard initializers aren't suitable for your application, you can create your own.
trans-unit.target: If the standard initializers aren't suitable for your application, you can create your own.

trans-unit.source: Use Context Initializers to set values that will be used to initialize every telemetry client.
trans-unit.target: Use Context Initializers to set values that will be used to initialize every telemetry client.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have published more than one version of your app, you could make sure you can separate the data by filtering on a custom property:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have published more than one version of your app, you could make sure you can separate the data by filtering on a custom property:

trans-unit.source: Use Telemetry Initializers to add processing to each event.
trans-unit.target: Use Telemetry Initializers to add processing to each event.

trans-unit.source: For example, the web SDK flags as failed any request with a response code >= 400.
trans-unit.target: For example, the web SDK flags as failed any request with a response code >= 400.

trans-unit.source: You could override that behavior:
trans-unit.target: You could override that behavior:

trans-unit.source: To install your initializers, add lines in ApplicationInsights.config:
trans-unit.target: To install your initializers, add lines in ApplicationInsights.config:

trans-unit.source: Alternatively you can write code to install the initializer at an early point in execution of your application.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively you can write code to install the initializer at an early point in execution of your application.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: InstrumentationKey
trans-unit.target: InstrumentationKey

trans-unit.source: This determines the Application Insights resource in which your data appears.
trans-unit.target: This determines the Application Insights resource in which your data appears.

trans-unit.source: Typically you create a separate resource, with a separate key, for each of your applications.
trans-unit.target: Typically you create a separate resource, with a separate key, for each of your applications.

trans-unit.source: If you want to set the key dynamically - for example if you want to send results from your application to different resources - you can omit the key from the configuration file, and set it in code instead.
trans-unit.target: If you want to set the key dynamically - for example if you want to send results from your application to different resources - you can omit the key from the configuration file, and set it in code instead.

trans-unit.source: To set the key for all instances of TelemetryClient, including standard telemetry modules, set the key in TelemetryConfiguration.Active.
trans-unit.target: To set the key for all instances of TelemetryClient, including standard telemetry modules, set the key in TelemetryConfiguration.Active.

trans-unit.source: Do this in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:
trans-unit.target: Do this in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:

trans-unit.source: If you just want to send a specific set of events to a different resource, you can set the key for a specific TelemetryClient:
trans-unit.target: If you just want to send a specific set of events to a different resource, you can set the key for a specific TelemetryClient:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Learn more about the API[api]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Learn more about the API[api]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To get a new key, <link><linkText>create a new resource in the Application Insights portal[new]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To get a new key, <link><linkText>create a new resource in the Application Insights portal[new]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
